intro: Dichromena nervosa, commonly known as the veined dichromena, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and simple, alternate leaves with prominent veins. Its small, pale yellow flowers are typically clustered in axillary inflorescences. Dichromena nervosa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
